intro: Spermacoce nelidae, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release small, smooth seeds. The botanical features of Spermacoce nelidae make it an interesting subject for ecological and medicinal studies.
